intro: Tulipa clusiana var. chrysantha, commonly known as the golden tulip, is a botanical variant of the tulip species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range from pale yellow to deep golden hues. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, blooming in late spring. This variety is prized for its vibrant color and is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
